subject: Investing
title: Global GDP and Market Cap Disconnect
description: A short lesson to help you apply Global GDP and Market Cap Disconnect.

hook.text: China produces 18% of world GDP but represents only 3% of global stock market capitalization.

buildup.text: GDP measures economic output. Market cap measures investable value. The two often diverge dramatically.

discovery.text: Emerging markets produce 40% of global GDP but account for just 12% of world stock market value.

twist.text: This gap means growth is underpricedâ€”or that poor governance and capital controls suppress market values.

climax.text: Investors who spot the convergenceâ€”where GDP growth eventually lifts market capâ€”capture outsized returns.

punchline.text: GDP shows where growth lives. Market cap shows where it's priced. Mind the gap.

quiz.question: Why is there a gap between emerging market GDP and market cap?
options: Governance issues and capital controls suppress valuations
